question: You mentioned working with crowdsourced security initiatives at companies like PayPal and Magento. Could you elaborate on how those early experiences have shaped your approach to product development and security management in your current role?

inputs.question: You mentioned working with crowdsourced security initiatives at companies like PayPal and Magento. Could you elaborate on how those early experiences have shaped your approach to product development and security management in your current role?

conversationHistory.content: Can you please share your background and your role at your current organization?

My current role is a Senior Manager of Product Management. My background is in engineering and product management with a focus on security. I spent several years working in security-related roles at Magento, an e-commerce company acquired by PayPal, eBay, and later by Adobe. At those companies, I worked directly on crowdsourced security. PayPal was one of the very first companies to have a public bug bounty program.

questions: Reflecting on your earlier involvement with crowdsourced security at companies like PayPal and Magento, how do you see those experiences influencing your overall perspective on integrating security into product management?
How have your experiences with public bug bounty programs and crowdsourced security initiatives shaped your approach to balancing product development and security strategies?
Can you provide specific examples of how lessons learned from working on crowdsourced security at PayPal and Magento are applied in your current security management and product development practices?
